title: 2025 NBA Finals: Previewing the Pacers-Thunder championship showdown
content: The 2025 NBA Finals are here! Our NBA insiders break down everything you need to know ahead of the series.

title: Art of the comeback: How to quantify this NBA playoffs' growing trend
content: Don't be surprised to see a major comeback in the Finals because nobody has mastered the art like the Pacers.

title: No. 1 Vandy, No. 2 Texas both ousted in regionals
content: Vanderbilt and Texas, the top two national seeds in the NCAA baseball tournament, were both eliminated in regionals Sunday, the first time that has happened since 2014.

title: Stark wins the U.S. Women's Open for first major
content: Maja Stark continued the steady play she had demonstrated all week to win the U.S. Women's Open and claim her first major championship Sunday at Erin Hills.

title: Sources: Royals calling up top prospect Caglianone
content: The Kansas City Royals are calling up slugger Jac Caglianone, one of the top prospects in baseball, less than a year after choosing him with the sixth pick in the draft, sources tell ESPN.

title: Rockies lower bar: 9-50 start worst in modern era
content: The Rockies (9-50) have been swept 10 times in 20 series this season and are the third-fastest team in MLB history to the 50-loss mark.

title: Seattle players demand fair MLS payout for CWC
content: Seattle Sounders FC players are demanding a fair share of the FIFA Club World Cup prize money the team secured when qualifying for the international tournament, and received backing from the Major League Soccer Players Association on Sunday.

title: De La Cruz hits emotional HR after sister's death
content: Reds star Elly De La Cruz insisted on playing just one day after learning of the death of his older sister, and he paid tribute to her with a towering home run.

title: Lynx unsatisfied with 7-0: 'Our goals are high'
content: The Minnesota Lynx are not satisfied with their 7-0 start, saying that they need to be more consistent to reach their ultimate goal.

title: 'Did it again': Nicklaus praises Scheffler for repeat
content: Scottie Scheffler won for the third time in his past four starts, never giving up his lead Sunday to become just the second golfer to defend his title at the Memorial.

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: Verstappen's petulance overshadows excellence in Spanish GP
content: Max Verstappen is among the greatest drivers in F1 history, but that legacy is being tarnished by his temper.

title: The Americans still playing at the 2025 French Open
content: American star Coco Gauff and newcomer Hailey Baptiste are still in the draw at the French Open -- but who else is? We break it down.

title: Has Swiatek just turned her season around?
content: Why Iga Swiatek's fourth-round win over Elena Rybakina at the French Open could be absolutely pivotal.

title: Takeaways: Why the Knicks got pummeled by the Pacers in Game 6
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: King of the impossible: How Luis Enrique rewarded PSG's faith with Champions League crown
content: Luis Enrique once swore he would never coach Paris Saint-Germain. Just over two years later, he has led the club to the pinnacle of the sport.

title: How PSG ended years of continental heartbreak to win the UCL
content: After a decade of prioritizing star power, PSG's youth movement finally ended the club's European futility.

title: Cruz Azul thrashes Whitecaps for 7th Concacaf title
content: Cruz Azul thrashed the Vancouver Whitecaps on Sunday night at the Estadio Olímpico Universitario in the final of the Concacaf Champions Cup to lift the trophy for a record-tying seventh time.

title: Injured Balogun dropped from U.S. Gold Cup squad
content: Forward Folarin Balogun will miss the Concacaf Gold Cup because of an ankle injury and was among three players dropped Sunday from a United States roster already without Christian Pulisic and Weston McKennie.

title: Lone fan greets Inter after PSG humiliation
content: A lone fan is reported to have been the only one to greet Inter Milan at the airport after their defeat to PSG in the Champions League final.

title: Beckham criticises on-tour Man United players
content: Manchester United legend David Beckham has said he has been disappointed by the behaviour of the squad during their postseason tour of Asia, saying he sees "a lot of things that are not acceptable."

title: Doué beats Yamal to Champions League award
content: Paris Saint-Germain winger Désiré Doué beat Barcelona's Lamine Yamal to win the Champions League Young Player of the Season award.

title: PSG bus parade overshadowed by fan deaths
content: PSG's open-top bus parade to celebrate winning the Champions League was overshadowed by the deaths of two people and some 200 injuries during overnight parties.

title: Man United officially lands Wolves star Cunha
content: Manchester United have agreed the signing of forward Matheus Cunha from Wolves pending visa and registration processes, the club announced on Sunday.

title: Ryan Blaney races to first Cup win of year at Nashville
content: Ryan Blaney ran away down the stretch for his first Cup Series victory of the year Sunday night at Nashville Superspeedway.

title: The NBA should be terrified of this OKC team
content: The Thunder have followed in the footsteps of the 2014-15 Warriors this season. Is this a future dynasty?

title: Knicks' biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Is Shedeur Sanders set up to win QB battle in Browns' new-look offense?
content: The Browns have a lot of new faces on offense, including at coordinator and under center, as they reshape the unit.

title: CFP format debate: Would SEC change cost bids? Does the 11+5 model make the most sense?
content: The debate about the future format of the CFP is raging. Particularly, how it hurts or helps the biggest leagues.

title: Men's summer transfer grades: Man United get a B for Cunha
content: The summer transfer window is now open, and clubs are starting to do business. Here is how we rate the biggest moves.

title: LAFC can now chase global dreams at Club World Cup after Club América comeback
content: LAFC want to be a global brand and have now punched a ticket to the 2025 Club World Cup with a thrilling comeback win over Club America.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle, Man Utd, Arsenal want Mbeumo
content: Bryan Mbeumo is a man in demand, with Newcastle, Man Utd and Arsenal all fighting for his signature. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning?

title: Why the Maple Leafs shouldn't re-sign Mitch Marner -- and what they should do instead
content: Toronto has some franchise-altering decisions to make this summer, starting with the perennial All-Star.

title: Updated NBA draft rankings: How the NCAA withdrawal deadline shook up the top 100
content: With 18 of our top 100 NBA prospects returning to college, there's movement in our list, starting at No. 5.

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: Delhi High Court rejects Christian officer’s plea, says armed forces united by uniform not religion
content: The court opined that the petitioner kept his religion above the lawful command from his superior, and disobedience was an offence under the Army Act

title: Rajeev Shukla set to become acting BCCI president
content: Binny, who had replaced Sourav Ganguly as Board president in 2022, turns 70 on July 19, crossing the age-limit threshold for an office-bearer

title: RSS leader Kalladka Prabhakar Bhat booked over alleged inflammatory speech in Dakshina Kannada
content: Kalladka Prabhakar Bhat delivered the speech during a condolence meeting organised in memory of the Hindutva activist Suhas Shetty, who was murdered on May 1

title: ‘Advance tipping’ under CCPA scanner: Bengaluru commuters urge probe into more apps
content: On May 21, Union Consumer Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi directed the CCPA to issue a notice to Uber regarding its use of advance tipping, where riders are prompted to tip drivers during the booking process, rather than after the ride

title: Supriya Sule-led delegation arrives in Egypt to convey India's stance on terrorism
content: The delegation arrived in Cairo after concluding their visit to Ethiopia on Sunday (June 1, 2025), Suresh Reddy, India's Ambassador to Egypt, received the delegation

title: Congress MLC urges Karnataka to pay additional RI of 4.25% to NABARD to avail more loans to grant farm credit
content: In 2024-25, NABARD provided ₹5,450 crore loan to the State Apex Bank at 4% interest rate, but limited the amount to ₹2,700 crore  in 2025-26

title: MLC seeks new inter-city rail services for Kalyana Karnataka
content: While commending the Union Government for upgrading infrastructure at rural railway stations, MLC points out that inter-city trains often do not halt at rural stations rendering such upgrades ineffective for regular passengers

title: Gandhi's principles more relevant today amid cross-border terrorism: Ravi Shankar Prasad in U.K.
content: "It is a matter of great pride for us that right in the heart of London before the great statue of Mahatma Gandhi, we have come to pay our respects and offer flowers"

title: IndiGo, Delta, Air France-KLM, Virgin Atlantic announce partnership
content: IndiGo is expanding its International network and is set to start flights to 10 overseas cities in the current fiscal ending March 2026

title: Nilambur byelection a fallout of betrayal, says Kerala CM
content: Anvar says Chief Minister uses communities to his advantage and abandons them when they are no longer needed, and terms it the ‘real betrayal.’

title: Late-night mission to Anvar’s house puts Mamkootathil in a spot
content: CPI(M) campaign in Nilambur alleges that Rahul Mamkootathil, at the behest of Satheesan, sought to beseech Mr. Anvar not to contest the bypoll

title: Indian summers are getting hotter, but is it the heat or is it us?
content: India’s heritage of traditional practices alongside modern science forms a rich foundation. The challenge lies in blending them to prepare India for its hottest years ahead

title: 71 human lives lost in Karnataka due to rains during pre-monsoon period
content: CM Siddaramaiah said on Saturday that a compensation of ₹5 lakh had been distributed to the families of the deceased

title: DMDK to make its position clear on alliance in January 2026, says Premallatha Vijayakant
content: Ms. Premallatha said that the announcement should be seen in relation to the upcoming assembly elections in 2026 and DMDK will also make its position clear appropriately in 2026

title: Top military officials from India, Pakistan share views at Shangri-La Dialogue
content: India accused Pakistan-based terror groups of a deadly attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam in April, while Pakistan denies any involvement

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy objects to supply of ration goods through fair price shops
content: Nearly 20,000 BC, SC, ST and minority beneficiaries, who rely on 9,260 MDUs, have been hit hard, he says

title: Ban on livestock markets before Eid is a harsh move on farmers: Prakash Ambedkar
content: Ahead of Bakri Eid, the Maharashtra Goseva Aayog in a circular issued on May 27, 2025, directed all the Agriculture Produce Market Committees to suspend weekly animal markets from June 3 to June 8 across the State.

title: Himachal Pradesh HC refuses to quash FIR against P&G in patent case
content: The FIR alleges that P&G invited the complaint to collaborate by submitting a patented innovation as part of its ‘Connect + Develop Programme’ and then used the technology in one of its products

title: BCI chairman seeks release, fair trial for arrested Instagram influencer Sharmishta Panoli
content: The 22-year-old influencer, a resident of Kolkata and enrolled in Pune's Law University, was arrested from Gurugram on May 30

title: Motorists lament poor condition of OMR-ECR link road, call for repairs
content: Residents say stones and dust hinder smooth flow of traffic on this vital road, which they take to bypass OMR that is in a bad shape; they say Metro Rail and Metrowater works add to their woes

title: IndiGo doubles its widebody aircraft order
content: The expanded order comes at a time the airline is set to enter the European market with non-stop flights to Manchester and Amsterdam in early July

title: Nilambur byelection evolves into a high-profile four-cornered electoral battle
content: While the ruling LDF in Kerala has fielded M. Swaraj and the Opposition UDF has picked Aryadan Shoukath, P.V. Anvar, whose resignation necessitated the byelection, too has declared his candidature; the BJP has joined the fray belatedly

title: CPI(M) opposes installation of smart prepaid meters by Adani Transmission Step Seven in A.P.
content: The leaders allege that the stage has been set for exploitation of the people, note that by paving the way for installation of smart meters, the TDP has betrayed the public

title: EY India Chairman Rajiv Memani takes over as CII President for FY26
content: Mr. Memani is also a member of the EY Global Executive Board, serving as the Chair of its Growth Markets Council.

title: BJP slams West Bengal govt. over arrest of influencer, calls action ‘selective enforcement’
content: Instagram influencer Sharmishta Panoli, 22, was arrested on Friday night for allegedly uploading a video with communal comments claiming Bollywood actors were silent on Operation Sindoor

title: Modi govt. believes in helping the last man in the queue, says Nadda
content: ‘Govt. has empowered women, farmers and marginalised sections of society by taking various measures for them, while others only talked about doing so’

title: RSS invites Bastar tribal leader to key Nagpur event
content: Will raise issues faced by tribals such as displacement and religious conversions, says former Minister and ex-Congressman Arvind Netam

title: 11-year-old Dalit rape victim dies of injuries in Patna
content: She was raped and found in a pit with 20 knife wounds in Bihar’s Muzaffarpur; Congress leader says she was left in ambulance outside Patna hospital for 5 hours before being admitted; party stages protest blaming NDA government for the death

title: Man held for hoax bomb threat at Thampanoor KSRTC bus station
content: The accused is also wanted by the Kochi City Police in connection with a similar bomb threat that targeted the Kochi Metro some months ago

title: Muthalvar Padaippagam, a co-working space, helps the budding businessmen cut cost
content: Entrepreneurs are utilising this well-equipped facility as a launch pad for their businesses. Started in 2024, it comprises a co-working space that includes meeting rooms and learning centres

title: Four more killed in northeast floods; 3.64 lakh affected in Assam; 1,500 tourists stranded in Sikkim
content: Mild to heavy rainfall continued to batter large swathes of the northeastern region, leaving 34 dead since May 28; major rivers breach embankments in Imphal; tourists stranded due to landslides in Sikkim

title: 17 women, look up to the sky
content: Seventeen women cadets graduated from Pune’s National Defence Academy on May 30, making them the first batch to participate in a joint training institution for the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force. Snehal Mutha reports on the experiences of the cadets who took on concerns around physical training and a system that was forced to adapt itself to the needs and aspirations of women

title: Hemavati canal project: Police register 13 FIRs against MLAs, seers over protest
content: The protest, which started with a group of around 400 people blocking the national highway and buring tyres, swelled to around 4,000, led by local leaders and seers of the mutt and their supporters.

title: New DGP faces challenge in establishing rule of law in U.P.: Mayawati
content: The newly appointed DGP Rajeev Krishna meets CM Yogi Adityanath, reiterates commitment to carry forward the priorities of government like zero tolerance towards crime and corruption, women’s safety

title: Keel laying of eighth anti-submarine warfare ship held
content: The contract for building eight ASW ships was signed between the Ministry of Defence and CSL on 30 April 2019

title: NHAI sets deadline to complete redevelopment of Kochi-Munnar NH 85 corridor
content: Resurfacing completed on around 100 km of the 124 km corridor being upgraded with a 10-metre-wide tarred carriageway. Sharp curves, including hairpin bends, are being widened, but work has been temporarily halted due to heavy rainfall, officials say

title: Double-engine government in Bihar failed to save a 11-year-old Dalit rape victim, says Congress
content: Congress leaders accuse the State government of negligence, claiming that the girl could have been saved had she been given proper treatment

title: Landslide-hit Vellarmala school in Wayanad gets a new beginning this academic year
content: New building has been constructed on the premises of the Government Higher Secondary School in Meppadi, where the Vellarmala school has been functioning since the landslides

title: Illegal gambling platforms pose grave threat to Indian youth: Report
content: The report reveals that from April 2024 to March 2025, the top 15 illegal gambling platforms garnered over 5.4 billion visits through 40 mirror sites.

title: Tamil Nadu among top heat-risk States in country; warmer nights put people at risk
content: Tamil Nadu ranks fifth among Indian States with high to very high heat risk, according to the study by the Council on Energy, Environment and Water

title: Despite the hurdles put up by the Centre, Tamil Nadu has emerged number one in growth, says Chief Minister Stalin
content: He says the BJP-led government at the Centre is trying to cripple the State’s economy by denying its rightful share. ‘Yet, we have overcome the hurdles and continue to be a welfare State’

title: Vijayashanti seeks Cabinet berth surprising many in the party
content: The popular actor of yesteryears had switched to the Congress from the BJP just before the elections and was largely inactive on the ground during the election campaign

title: Transport dept. to give work order to roll out advanced smart cards for driving licenses and vehicle registrations
content: The new smart cards will replace the current polyvinyl chloride (PVC) cards that have been in use for years. These advanced cards are seen as a leap forward in modernising transport documentation, combining robust materials and secure data storage methods

title: Karnataka achieves drastic reduction in ‘overdue’ cases before revenue courts: Minister
content: The experiment of Karnataka has created a social impact by reducing litigation, harassment and expenses for farmers, says Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda

title: President withholds assent to Malayalam Bill without giving reason in violation of SC order
content: Act leads to a constitutional challenge since as per the April 8 judgement of the SC in the Tamil Nadu Governor case, the President cannot exercise an absolute veto on Bills and cannot withhold assent without furnishing reasons

title: Free distribution of ‘kodelu’ (bulls) relaunched following death of 13 ‘kodelu’ at Vemulawada temple goshala
content: The pathetic condition of most of the kodelu in the overcrowded goshala sparked outrage among devotees

title: Political slugfest breaks out between Opposition and Congress over Hemavathi river link canal project
content: Congress MLAs HD Ranganath and HC Balakrishna for early completion of the project, while BJP and JD (S) legislators claim the project aimed to diver Hemavathi water to Ramanagara

title: New academic year: traffic regulations come into effect in Thiruvananthapuram city
content: Series of traffic regulations introduced to ensure the safe and smooth transportation of school and college students across the city

title: Scholarship camp for higher education evokes good response in Nagapattinam
content: A total of 483 applications were submitted by 200 students, with guidance from 42 trained volunteers from Talent Quest India and TNAU Kilvelur in the camp organised by the district administration

title: Somanna slams Siddaramaiah for implicating farmers opposing Hemavathi link canal project
content: The Central Minister says that the Chief Minister now-a-days is ‘like a train that missed the village station’

title: IUML questions Satheesan’s handling of Anvar issue
content: At a meeting, leaders like K.M. Shaji and M.K. Muneer question IUML’s silence when Satheesan ‘mishandled Anvar issue through a delaying tactic’

title: Multi-party delegations are to secure support for India, not highlight domestic political differences, says Salman Khurshid
content: Congress leader is part of the delegation that has visited Japan, Singapore, South Korea, Indonesia and Malaysia

title: Life Term For Man Who Sexually Assaulted 19-Year-Old In Anna University
content: Gnanasekaran, a biryani vendor convicted in the high-profile sexual assault case at the Anna University, has been sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: 4 New COVID-19 Deaths In India, Active Cases Near 4,000
content: India's active COVID-19 cases stand at 3,961 as of 8 AM on Monday, June 2, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The cumulative COVID-19 deaths in the country since January this year have increased to 32.

title: "Terror Has No Place In Our Countries": Shashi Tharoor On Colorado Attack
content: All-party delegation leader and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Monday said Members of the Indian MPs' delegation learnt with concern about the terror attack in Colorado and were relieved that there was no loss of life.

title: Bihar Dalit Girl Dies After Rape, Knife Attack. Waited 5 Hours For A Bed
content: A nine-year-old Dalit girl in Bihar's Muzaffarpur was raped and the attacker slit her throat and fled. The minor was later found, bloodied and semi-naked, by her mother. She was rushed to the nearest hospital and then referred to Patna

title: Woman Injured After Cylinder Blast Triggers Fire In Delhi's Wazirpur
content: A fire broke out in Delhi's Wazirpur industrial area, following a cylinder blast early Monday morning.

title: "Biden Is A Clone": Inside Trump's New Conspiracy Theory On Predecessor
content: US President Trump recently shared another conspiracy theory on social media, saying his predecessor, Joe Biden, was "executed in 2020" and replaced by a robotic clone.

title: "Proud": Himanta Sarma As Assam Girl Gets 3rd Position In Britain's Got Talent
content: Binita Chetry had set the Britain's Got Talent stage ablaze with her extraordinary dance skills, including backflips, handstands, and impressive flexibility.

title: Sensex Slides Over 700 Points As Trump Plans To Double Steel Tariffs
content: Indian equities tumbled in early trade as renewed tariff threats from US President Donald Trump dampened investor sentiments. Sensex fell over 700 points while Nifty lost 200 points, marking a steep fall during the earnings season.

title: Virat Kohli's Bengaluru Pub Charged For Not Having Designated Smoking Zone
content: Cricketer Virat Kohli-owned One 8 Commune pub and restaurant in Bengaluru has run into trouble again, after the Cubbon Park Police registered a suo-moto case for Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA) violations.

title: Priyanka Gandhi Expresses Grief Over Deaths Due To Floods In Northeast
content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra expressed grief over the deaths caused by heavy rains and floods in northeastern states,including Assam and Arunachal Pradesh, affecting lakhs of people.

title: Pakistan Is Not A "Democratic Country": Ravi Shankar Prasad In UK
content: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad, leading the all-party delegation in the UK, said that Pakistan is not a "democratic country" and added that Pakistan's armed forces have made the country for themselves and are "unelectable and unaccountable."

title: "Terrorism Against Jews": Israel's UN Envoy Condemns Colorado Attack
content: Israel's Ambassador to the United Nations, Danny Danon, has condemned the violent attack on a group of Jewish demonstrators in Boulder, Colorado, as an act of terrorism.

title: Ukraine's Op Spider Web Zelensky's Message To Russia -- And Trump Too
content: Shortly after Ukraine's surprise drone attack on Russian airfields, the Business Ukraine magazine posted on X: "Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy = King of Drones. Who 'doesn't have any cards' now?"

title: Polish Nationalist Karol Nawrocki Ahead In Presidential Election Runoff
content: Nationalist historian Karol Nawrocki, who is predicted to have won Sunday's presidential election in Poland, is a former amateur boxer with a particular interest in the criminal underworld.

title: "Groundless": China Rejects Trump's 'Beijing Violated Geneva Trade Deal' Claim
content: The ministry said China had implemented and actively upheld the agreement reached last month in Geneva, while the US had introduced multiple "discriminatory restrictive" measures against China.

title: Retired School Principal Duped Of Rs 1.02 Crore In A Digital Arrest
content: The scam involved fraudsters claiming to be from Mumbai's Colaba Police and CBI, alleging that the retired principal, Nandini Chiplunkar, was involved in financial dealings with Naresh Goyal of Jet Airways and money laundering.

title: Who Is Mohamed Sabry Soliman, Suspect Behind Colorado Fire Bomb Attack
content: At least six people were injured in what the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) called a "targeted terror attack" outside a mall in Boulder, Colorado, where a group of Israeli supporters were protestors.

title: "Drones Hidden In Trucks": How Ukraine Struck 5 Airfields Deep Inside Russia
content: Ukraine on Sunday orchestrated a massive drone attack targeting five key Russian military airbases in its "most long-range operation", striking targets deep into Russian territory--thousands of kilometres from the front line.

title: Pakistan crop-sowing in crisis as dams run low, India tightens Chenab flow
content: Pakistan faces a looming crisis in its kharif crop sowing season due to critically low water levels in the Mangla and Tarbela dams. The situation is worsened by India's regulation of Chenab river flows and suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty after the Pahalgam attack.

title: Anna University rape case: Court sentences convict Gnanasekaran to life imprisonment
content: A Gnanasekaran has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Chennai Mahila Court for the Anna University rape case, with a minimum of 30 years in jail. Judge M Rajalakshmi found him guilty on 11 counts under various laws, including rape and IT Act violations. The survivor reported that Gnanasekaran threatened her on campus and recorded the assault.

title: 'Saw big flame as high as tree': Eyewitnesses recount Colorado attack horror
content: During a march in Colorado supporting Israeli hostages, a suspect attacked the group with a makeshift flamethrower and Molotov cocktails, injuring six people. Witnesses described a chaotic scene with victims suffering severe burns. The FBI is investigating the incident as a targeted terror attack, identifying the suspect as Mohamed Sabry Solimanw, who allegedly shouted "Free Palestine" during the assault.

title: Why BCCI could get a new president, after Roger Binny, soon
content: Roger Binny's tenure as BCCI president is nearing its end due to age restrictions, potentially paving the way for Rajeev Shukla to take over. Binny's presidency saw India's success in the T20 World Cup and Champions Trophy, alongside the introduction of the Women's Premier League. His focus also included strengthening domestic cricket.

title: Punjab AAP sarpanch dies by suicide; friends allege harassment by senior party leader
content: Jashan Bawa, an AAP member and sarpanch, died by suicide in Ferozepur district. He reportedly shot himself. Friends say he felt sidelined by senior AAP leaders. A poem posted on his Facebook wall hinted at his intentions. Villagers gathered, requesting an inquiry. Friends allege harassment by a senior AAP leader. The family proceeded with the cremation.

title: Who is Megha Vemuri, Indian-American student banned from MIT ceremony
content: Megha Vemuri, MIT's Class of 2025 president, was banned from her graduation after delivering a pro-Palestine speech criticizing the university's ties with Israel. MIT cited disruption of an official event as the reason, leading to online backlash and Vemuri deleting her LinkedIn profile. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions surrounding campus activism and free speech related to the Israel-Gaza conflict.

title: Vanessa Bryant breaks silence on pregnancy rumors, shares Rihanna meme
content: Vanessa Bryant addressed pregnancy rumors with a playful Instagram Story featuring Rihanna, shutting down speculation with humor and a clear message about protecting her peace. She emphasized the importance of inner character over material possessions, sharing motivational quotes and highlighting her focus on family and philanthropy. Bryant's response underscored her right to privacy amidst public scrutiny.

title: Top Pak general flags ‘Kashmir’ in Singapore, warns of ‘destructive escalation’
content: At the Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore, Pakistan's Gen. Sahir Shamshad Mirza designated Kashmir as the core issue fueling India-Pakistan tensions, advocating for international intervention. He urged conflict resolution aligned with UN Security Council resolutions, suggesting the US, UK, Saudi Arabia, China, Turkiye, and UAE as potential mediators.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO's warning to US on China tariffs: They're not scared...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon cautioned American officials against underestimating China's resilience in the trade conflict, highlighting their preparedness and determination. He warned against expecting China to concede to American pressure, emphasizing their capacity to address challenges with significant resources. Dimon also expressed concerns about the United States' overall readiness for future global conflicts, particularly in military strength.

title: ‘Assaulted, burnt with cigarettes’: 2 autistic brothers raped at boarding school in Dehradun
content: In Dehradun, two autistic brothers, aged 9 and 13, were allegedly subjected to horrific abuse at a boarding school shortly after their admission in April. A staff member, Monu Pal, has been accused of physically assaulting, burning with cigarettes, and raping the children. The accused has been arrested, and police are investigating the unregistered facility and its operations.

title: Shreyas Iyer: All rise for the 'Sarpanch' of Punjab Kings
content: Around an hour past midnight, Shreyas Iyer hit four sixes, looting 26 runs from the 19th over bowled by rookie Ashwani Kumar of Mumbai Indians (MI) to take Punjab Kings (PBKS) to their first IPL final in 11 years. PBKS defeated MI by five wickets in the rain-affected Qualifier 2 to seal their final spot, where they will lock horns against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Tuesday.

title: 3.64 lakh hit by floods in 19 Assam districts, northeast reels under deluge
content: Assam grapples with severe flooding affecting over 3.64 lakh people across 19 districts, prompting rescue missions and IAF deployment. Cachar is the worst-hit, with rising river levels exacerbating the crisis. Northeast India faces grim conditions with flood-related deaths reaching 34, while authorities issue red alerts for several districts amid ongoing heavy rainfall and rising water levels.

title: WhatsApp will not work on these iPhones & Androids, check if yours is in list
content: Starting June 1, 2025, WhatsApp will discontinue support for older iPhones lacking iOS 15.1 and Android devices below version 5.1. This update, delayed from May 5th, aims to enhance security and performance by leveraging newer OS features. Affected users are advised to upgrade their devices, explore alternative messaging apps, or back up their chats to avoid service disruptions.

title: DMDK to reconsider alliance after AIADMK defers Rajya Sabha seat
content: The DMDK voiced its discontent with the AIADMK's decision to postpone the allocation of a Rajya Sabha seat until 2026, despite a prior written commitment. Premlatha Vijayakanth announced that DMDK will reveal its alliance plans before the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections. AIADMK leaders have reassured that the alliance remains intact, despite DMDK's concerns.

title: Stock market crash today: Nifty goes below 24,550; Sensex tanks over 750 points
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in deep red on Monday. While Nifty50 went below 24,550, BSE Sensex tanked over 750 points.

title: Gold price prediction for June 2: Should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are navigating a complex landscape influenced by geopolitical tensions, US-China trade uncertainties, and fluctuating economic data. Recent events, such as the postponement of US tariffs and ongoing conflicts, have contributed to market volatility.

title: Watch: Chaos erupts at pro-Israel event as man hurls 'Molotov cocktails' at crowd in Colorado
content: In Boulder, Colorado, a peaceful gathering supporting Israeli hostages turned violent when Mohamed Sabry Soliman, 45, allegedly shouted "Free Palestine" and launched an incendiary device into the group. Six people, mainly elderly, sustained injuries, some severe. The FBI is investigating the incident as a terrorist act.

title: Weinstein accused of assault by woman who filed lawsuit against ‘Diddy’?
content: Crystal McKinney, who had sued Sean 'Diddy' Combs, has now filed an amended complaint against Harvey Weinstein. She accuses Weinstein of assaulting her and a friend in 2003. McKinney claims Weinstein plied them with alcohol in a hotel room. She alleges he grabbed her chest and ripped her top. Weinstein then allegedly forced them into sexual acts.

title: JEE result, final answer key released: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kanpur has announced the JEE Advanced 2025 results and released the final answer key on June 2. Candidates can access their scorecards at jeeadv.ac.in using their roll number, birth date, and mobile number. Over 1.8 lakh aspirants await JoSAA counselling for admissions to IITs and other top engineering institutions.

title: Watch: Shreyas Iyer loses his cool at Shashank Singh after win vs MI
content: Despite Shreyas Iyer's match-winning 87, tensions flared after Punjab Kings' IPL Qualifier 2 victory against Mumbai Indians. Iyer visibly berated teammate Shashank Singh for a crucial run-out during the tense chase of 204. The incident occurred post-victory, with Iyer expressing his anger through strong gestures. Despite the setback, Punjab Kings secured a spot in the final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: Bihar rape victim made to wait hours in ambulance dies
content: An 11-year-old Dalit girl, brutally raped and stabbed in Muzaffarpur, died at Patna Medical College Hospital after a delayed admission. The victim was kept in an ambulance for over four hours, allegedly due to hospital apathy. The accused has been arrested, while the incident sparks outrage and protests over healthcare negligence and rising sexual assault cases in the region.

title: Elon Musk vs Cory Booker: A tale of two 'Nazi salutes'
content: In January 2025, at Donald Trump’s second inauguration—a carnival of CPAC cosplay, Mar-a-Lago loyalists, and Liberty University dropouts—Elon Musk stepped on stage, placed his hand over his heart, and extended his arm outward with the ceremonial stiffness of a Leni Riefenstahl extra. Reuters confirms the gesture and backlash.

title: Kalpika Ganesh shares video of birthday clash at pub; netizens react
content: Kalpika Ganesh, a Telugu actress, celebrated her birthday at a Hyderabad pub. The celebration turned sour due to a disagreement with the pub's management. Kalpika alleged disrespectful treatment and denial of a birthday cake. A video of the incident went viral, sparking mixed reactions online. Some criticized Kalpika for demanding free items. Others sympathized with her, condemning the alleged mistreatment.

title: Who is Mohamed Sabry Soliman? Suspect in Colorado firebomb attack
content: In Boulder, Colorado, a pro-Israel vigil was targeted by Mohamed Sabry Soliman, an Egyptian national illegally present in the US, who allegedly set six attendees on fire while shouting "Free Palestine." The FBI is investigating the incident as a targeted act of terrorism, as the victims, aged 67 to 88, sustained injuries ranging from minor to severe burns.

title: Vitamin B12 deficiency: Symptoms you should not ignore
content: Vitamin B12, vital for DNA synthesis, energy, and nerve function, is deficient in many, especially those over 60. Deficiency signs include fatigue, pale skin, headaches, and mood changes. Oral issues like glossitis and neurological symptoms such as numbness and balance problems may arise.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends Radico Khaitan and JK Cement as top stock picks for the week starting June 2, 2025. Radico Khaitan, a leading IMFL manufacturer, is projected to experience robust growth driven by premiumization. JK Cement reported strong fourth-quarter results and aims for significant volume growth and cost savings, making it a preferred pick in the cement sector.

title: Watch: Carlsen bangs fist on board after shock loss to D Gukesh
content: D Gukesh achieved a stunning victory over Magnus Carlsen in Round 6 of Norway Chess, marking his first classical win against the former World No. 1. Carlsen faltered in the endgame, allowing Gukesh to capitalise despite acknowledging his losing position. This win propelled Gukesh to third place in the standings, intensifying the competition as the tournament nears its conclusion.

title: Kangana Ranaut, Pawan Kalyan slam WB cops over arrest of Sharmishta Panoli
content: BJP MP Kangana Ranaut criticized the Bengal government, cautioning against turning the state into "North Korea," following the arrest of social media influencer Sharmishta Panoli for a controversial video. Andhra Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan questioned the "selective outrage," emphasizing that secularism should apply equally.

title: John Brenkus, host of Emmy-winning show 'Sport Science', dies
content: John Brenkus, the creator and host of "Sport Science," has passed away at the age of 54 after a battle with depression. The Emmy-winning personality, who openly discussed his mental health challenges, is remembered for his contributions to sports broadcasting through his innovative show, where he broke down the mathematics and science in play in sport.

title: 'Targeted terror attack': Man attacks crowd with firebombs in Colorado, several injured
content: In Boulder, Colorado, several individuals sustained injuries in what the FBI is investigating as targeted terror attacks. A man allegedly threw Molotov cocktail-like devices near pro-Israeli demonstrators. While police have a suspect in custody, the Boulder police chief refutes the FBI's terror claim, citing the investigation's early stage.

title: Air India to shift maintenance work from Turkish firm in view of 'public sentiment'
content: Air India plans to decrease its reliance on Turkish Technic for wide-body aircraft maintenance due to geopolitical tensions, redirecting operations to MRO facilities in the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and the US. CEO Campbell Wilson emphasized the airline's sensitivity to national sentiment and its commitment to adjusting plans in response to recent developments.

title: Russian defence ministry confirms 5 airbases targeted in Ukrainian drone strike
content: Russia's defence ministry confirmed Ukrainian drone strikes on five airbases, acknowledging damage to aircraft. Kyiv is accused of launching the attacks, some from locations near airfields in Murmansk and Irkutsk. Ukraine claims to have destroyed around 40 Russian military planes. Observers suggest the attacks aim to pressure Moscow before peace talks in Istanbul, though analysts remain skeptical of a breakthrough.

title: PM to hold the first meeting of Council of Ministers this week after Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to convene the first Council of Ministers meeting this week following Operation Sindoor, preceding the completion of his first year in his third term. Ministers have been briefed about the upcoming meeting, where government departments will present updates on various schemes and programs.

title: Ayushman enrolments see dip as private hospitals back off over rates, delays
content: Hospital empanelment under the Ayushman Bharat-PM Jan Arogya Yojana has significantly decreased, dropping from 316 monthly in early 2024 to just 111 by April 2025. Healthcare associations attribute this decline to low package rates and delayed payments, deterring private hospitals, especially large chains.

title: Social media agrees with LeBron James raising concerns about kids burning out from early sports
content: LeBron James raised concerns about kids focusing on one sport early. He shared his experience of playing multiple sports. He feels early specialization leads to burnout and injuries. Social media users agreed with James. They highlighted the lack of cross-training. Parents pushing kids for financial gains was also a concern. James' sons Bronny and Bryce play basketball.

title: With Sindoor focus, BJP eyes TMC's core female vote bank
content: Amit Shah asserted that the era of appeasement politics in Bengal is ending, projecting BJP's victory in 2026 by gaining support from Hindu and women voters. He accused Mamata Banerjee of prioritizing vote-bank politics over national security, alleging open borders to Bangladeshis and opposing waqf amendments.

title: 'Our most long-range op': Zelenskyy hails ‘brilliant’ drone strikes on Russia
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy lauded a drone strike deep within Russia, calling it a "brilliant result" that destroyed over 40 aircraft, including strategic bombers. The Security Service (SBU) claimed the operation, dubbed "Operation Spider Web," caused billions in damage and significantly impacted Russia's air missile carrier fleet.

title: Experts reveal that this diet can reduce heart disease risk
content: A recent Harvard study, presented at NUTRITION 2025, reveals that food quality is paramount for heart health, surpassing the focus on simply cutting carbs or fats. The decades-long research, involving nearly 200,000 participants, demonstrates that diets rich in whole grains, fruits, and vegetables significantly lower coronary heart disease risk by approximately 15%, regardless of whether they are low-carb or low-fat.

title: For Indian students, US dreams suddenly in doubt
content: Amidst the Trump administration's restrictive policies, Indian students aspiring to study in the US face uncertainty, with visa interviews paused and social media scrutiny increased. Many are altering online presence, seeking guidance, and exploring alternative academic paths in Britain and Singapore. Despite the challenges, American universities continue to attract top Indian talent, producing global leaders.

title: Farting can reduce your blood pressure, says science
content: Emerging research from Johns Hopkins University suggests a surprising link between gut health and blood pressure. The study reveals that hydrogen sulfide, a gas produced during digestion, may help dilate arteries, promoting healthy blood flow and potentially reducing hypertension. Maintaining a balanced gut microbiome through diet could support cardiovascular function, highlighting the interconnectedness of bodily systems.

title: Hurricane 2025 names announced: Date, time, important details to know
content: The 2025 Atlantic hurricane season, running from June 1 to November 30, is predicted to be volatile. The WMO has released the storm name list, replacing 'Dorian' with 'Dexter' due to the former's devastating impact. Experts warn of increasing hurricane strength and frequency due to global warming.

title: 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' box office collection: Film inches towards the Rs 60cr mark
content: Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' is captivating audiences with its time-loop narrative, nearing Rs. 60 crore in India after a 10-day theatrical run. The film experienced a significant surge during its second weekend, with collections rising notably on Saturday and Sunday. The movie revolves around Ranjan in Banaras, who gets stuck reliving his 'haldi day' due to a broken promise.

title: ‘Absconding, shared hate content’: What police said about Sharmistha Panoli’s arrest
content: Kolkata Police defended the arrest of Instagram influencer Sharmistha Panoli, clarifying it was due to a video allegedly insulting religious beliefs and promoting communal disharmony, not her political views. Police stated that Panoli was absconding after failing to comply with legal notices, leading to her arrest in Gurugram.

title: UPI transactions hit new high in May but cash still thriving
content: Despite the surge in UPI transactions, cash usage, particularly the Rs 500 note, remains surprisingly high in India, reaching record levels. This phenomenon is attributed to precautionary hoarding driven by economic uncertainties stemming from the Covid-19 pandemic. While the government promotes digital payments and smaller denominations, the preference for liquidity persists, reversing the pre-pandemic trend of reduced cash holdings.

title: Chhattisgarh CM Vishnudeo Sai sees turning point in war on Maoists
content: Chhattisgarh CM Vishnudeo Sai asserts that targeted welfare and security operations have significantly weakened Maoist networks in Bastar, paving the way for lasting peace. He aims for a Naxal-free Chhattisgarh by March 2026, emphasizing development and inclusive policies. The government is committed to addressing concerns about mining and ensuring tribal communities benefit from development.

title: 'If verdict out abroad but trial on in India, case must be heard at length'
content: A Delhi court is reviewing a money laundering case involving Shravan Gupta, who was convicted in Abu Dhabi for similar offenses. Gupta is challenging a summons issued by an Indian court, arguing double jeopardy under the Indian Constitution and CrPC.

title: EA Sports College Football 26 gameplay officially revealed in new trailer
content: college football 26 will include thousands of real college players and over 300 real-world coaches . the game also has added over 2700 new plays, which EA Sports says will make for "authentic college football like never before" the series started in 1993 with the release of Bill Walsh College Football on the Sega Genesis .

title: 🍿 Pacers troll Knicks after NBA Finals berth
content: Indiana defeated the new york Knicks in six games in the Eastern Conference finals . the Pacers are embracing everything about advancing to the NBA Finals for the first time since 2000 . Indiana will take on the Oklahoma City Thunder and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander in the finals, which begin Thursday (8:30 p.m. ET, ABC).

title: 2025 WCWS: Results, schedule and updates from OKC
content: the stakes are rising at the 2025 women's college world series in Oklahoma City . it's the Lady Vols' second WCWS semifinal appearance in the past three seasons . Texas finally broke through against rival Oklahoma to advance to the semifinals with a 4-2 victory .

title: Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen ties knot with actress and singer Hailee Steinfeld
content: Buffalo Bills  quarterback  Josh Allen  made quite the catch, marrying his fiancée, musician and actress Hailee Steinfeld, on Saturday, according to multiple reports. The pair  announced their engagement  in November with the proposal taking place during the Bills' bye week. The following week, Allen described his bye as "fantastic." They were first linked together publicly in the spring of 2023. The reigning MVP quarterback was in attendance and participating in Tuesday's voluntary organized team activities with the Bills, while Steinfeld is coming off the success of her latest film, "Sinners," which surpassed a $200 million domestic total. Coach Sean McDermott was asked whether he had seen any jitters from Allen on Tuesday. "Jitters from Josh? I'm not going to get into any of that," McDermott said. "Good try on that. But he is as confident and as calm, cool and collected as he always is."

title: F1 25 review -- A familiar package with a shining, compelling story mode
content: the introduction of the Braking Point story mode into the series has been interesting to watch . fans of the series scorned it for using up resources that could've gone into the more traditional modes . it's a trend that EA Sports F1 25 will likely continue .

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Florida Panthers 3-0 in the last year's Stanley Cup final . Connor McDavid and the Oilers won the next three to force a Game 7 . the oilers defeated their in-state rivals, the Tampa Bay Lightning in the first round, the Toronto Maple Leafs in a seven-game second round .
